item.title: Fall 2019 - We're Back!
item.description: .col3 { columns: 2 100px; -webkit-columns: 2 100px; -moz-columns: 2 100px; } via GIPHY We‚Äôre back! Welcome back to another year of #RLadies #LdnOnt! This year we are starting out with three NEW organizers of R-Ladies London: Olivia, Caitlin and Daryn. A little bit about us: All three of us are 4th year combined speech-language pathology MClSc/PhD candidates (yes, we met through that!). via GIPHY I‚Äôm Olivia, my work focuses on partnering with speech-language pathologists in developing new measures of spoken language development for young children with hearing loss.

item.title: So long, farewell, and stay tuned!
item.description: via GIPHY Thus concludes this season of R-Ladies #LdnOnt! Thank you to Jaky for leading us through our last workshop together, and to all of you who came out to these things over the last two and a half years. Workshop materials are posted in the usual places (website, GitHub, Drive). Some news that I‚Äôve spoken about a bit in person but not in any official capacity yet: Sally and I are stepping down as organizers.

item.title: Upcoming workshop: Data cleaning and exploration in R
item.description: Join us for our last R-Ladies #LdnOnt meet up of the season! Quick deets! ‚ùì What is R-Ladies? A low-key get together for people interested in using and learning more about R, a powerful statistical software program. We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Thursday, May 30, 5:30 - 7:30 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Lawson Room on the first floor, across from the main library entrance (formerly known as the Richmond Room).

item.title: Upcoming workshop: R Markdown and bookdown for dissertating
item.description: Materials for our tutorial on dissertating in R Markdown with bookdown! Tutorial Materials

item.title: Spring 2019 Workshops Announced!
item.description: via GIPHY Spring lineup We are PUMPED to announce a series of #RLadies #LdnOnt workshops for the upcoming season! All workshops will be held the last Thursday of the month at 5:30 p.m. at the London Public Library downtown. March 28: Heatmaps & Pointmaps using ggmap led by Rebecca Henderson April 25: Dissertating in RMarkdown led by Thea Knowles May 30: TBD led by Jaky Kueper Watch this space for more details as meet up information is announced!

item.title: SPSS 2 R: Materials
item.description: See you next year, R-Ladies! And thus concludes our final R-Ladies #LdnOnt event of 2018! Thanks to Daryn for leading our last workshop of the season, Transitioning from SPSS to R, version 2.0. We were a smaller crowd this time (that‚Äôs the end of the academic term, for you), but I think these are a great set of resources to have. SPSS 2 R: Two for the price of one!

We will be in the Richmond Room on the first floor, across from the main library entrance.

item.title: Figuring out figures in R using ggplot: Workshop materials
item.description: Thanks to all who came out for our October meet up! You can find the code we used for the figures, along with the data and the source code used to make the presentation at our Github or on our Google Drive. The slides presented at the workshop are below (or, if you‚Äôd like a larger version, here)

We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Thursday, October 25, 5:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Creativity Lab on the 2nd floor.

item.title: Info about new Western grad student group: Computational Social Science
item.description: One of our R-Ladies members is co-piloting a new venture that some of you who are Western grad students may be interested in: a group for people interested in Computational Social Science. See more below! Note this is not an R-Ladies event, but may feature content that overlaps with many of our members‚Äô interests. Calling all Western graduate students! If you are interested in Causal Inference/ Machine Learning/ Quantitative Methods and the social sciences - a group of graduate students at Western are organizing a new club focusing on Computational Social Science!

item.description: Quick deets! ‚ùì What is R-Ladies? A low-key get together for people interested in using and learning more about R, a powerful statistical software program. We meet about once a month to feature different topics and speakers. üïõ When: Tuesday, September 25, 5:00 p.m. - 7:00 p.m. üìçWhere: London Public Library, Central Branch (251 Dundas, right downtown). We will be in the Training Room (formerly the Wellington Room) on the 2nd floor.

item.title: Looking for presenters for this coming year of R-Ladies #LdnOnt
item.description: Know some R? Share with our team! As we gear up for our third year of R-Ladies #LdnOnt, we are actively looking for people who would be interested in presenting a tutorial at one of our future meet ups. Our presenters have ranged from relatively new R users all the way up to seasoned R experts; the ideal R-Ladies tutorial presenter would fall anywhere along that continuum! Goal: Skill-swapping Our main goal is to provide an environment in which people interested in learning R can share their skills and learn with other like-minded folks.

item.title: Past Events
item.description: All materials are available in our GitHub repository and on Google Drive. Links to each workshop below. Data cleaning and exploration in R (2019-05-30) Led by Jaky Kueper Dissertating with R Markdown and bookdown (2019-04-25) Led by Thea Knowles Additional materials on GitHub or Drive Heatmaps and Pointmaps using ggmap (2019-03-28) Led by Rebecca Henderson Transitioning from SPSS to R (2018-11-29) Led by Daryn Cushnie-Sparrow Presentations for 2017, 2018 versions of this workshop Figuring out figures in R with ggplot (2018-10-25)

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to the new landing site of R-Ladies London, Ontario! The R-Ladies London, Ontario chapter (aka R-Ladies #LdnOnt) has been in operation since January 2017. Check out this post to learn more about how we got started and where we are now. This site will serve as a central landing point for anyone wishing to know more about us or access our materials. What is this R-Ladies you speak of?

item.title: Workshop: Making Science Open With R!
item.description: üéâ Next meet up: Making Science Open with R! Led by @monsauce. üéâ Learn about how #rstats, #rmarkdown, and Google Sheets can work together for you to create a reproducible workflow. Join us on June 26 at 5pm at the @LondonPublicLib! All are welcome. https://t.co/fZN2Atoxv6 pic.twitter.com/C6HjqCYbG2 ‚Äî R-Ladies LdnOnt (@RLadiesLdnOnt) June 6, 2018 Details Join us for our last meet up until the fall! We are thrilled to have Monica Granados back with us again to close out our second year!
